etymologies: mid 19th century. From scientific Latin Alocasia, genus name (J. de NeckerElementa botanica III. 289), probably an alteration of colocasia

definitions: Any of various plants constituting the genus Alocasia (family Araceae), comprising rhizomatous and tuberous perennials native chiefly to tropical Asia, which have large cordate or sagittate leaves borne on long petioles, and are grown for ornament and sometimes as a food crop. Also (in form Alocasia): this genus itself.

notes.text: Valid publication of the genus name: G. Don Sweet's Hortus Britannicus (1830) (ed. 3) 631.
